security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based meta-skill that orchestrates other skills. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no command execution. Provides workflow instructions only.

content.value_statement: Developing new features requires coordinating multiple tasks across backend, frontend, testing, and documentation. This skill orchestrates the entire development workflow from requirements analysis through automated quality checks to pull request creation, ensuring consistent quality standards.
actual_capabilities: Orchestrates 6 specialized skills in sequence (analyze-requirements, develop-backend, develop-frontend, review-architecture, qa-check, create-pr)
Manages git branch creation and validation before development starts
Automatically retries failed phases until quality standards are met
Enforces 80% test coverage and zero lint/build errors
Generates comprehensive completion reports with metrics
Supports backend, frontend, or fullstack implementation targets
limitations: Cannot run standalone - requires other skills to be installed
Depends on project having proper development environment setup
Quality checks pass only when project meets defined standards
Does not modify project configuration or install dependencies

best_practices: Define clear feature names and link to issue tracking before starting
Prepare specification documents and Figma designs before invoking the skill
Ensure your project meets minimum quality standards (lint config, test setup)
Review each phase output to catch issues early in the workflow
anti_patterns: Running without an issue number - breaks traceability and branch naming
Skipping specification documents - leads to inconsistent implementations
Ignoring architecture review failures - technical debt accumulates
Modifying files outside the feature branch - creates merge conflicts

faq.question: What skills are required before using create-feature?
faq.answer: You need to install analyze-requirements, develop-backend, develop-frontend, review-architecture, qa-check, and create-pr skills first.

faq.question: What happens if a phase fails?
faq.answer: The skill automatically retries the failing phase after you make corrections, repeating until quality standards are met.

faq.question: Can I run only backend or only frontend?
faq.answer: Yes, set the target parameter to 'backend', 'frontend', or 'fullstack' to control which parts execute.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill that orchestrates other skills. It does not access files, network, or execute commands directly.

faq.question: Why did qa-check fail with good test coverage?
faq.answer: QA checks include lint errors, build failures, and test pass rates. Review the QA output to identify the specific failure reason.

faq.question: How is this different from calling individual skills directly?
faq.answer: Create-feature ensures proper sequencing, enforces quality gates between phases, and provides a complete development workflow with reporting.
